newsitem.title: USA: Chase Brass cites strong Q3, hopes for record year.
newsitem.headline: Chase Brass cites strong Q3, hopes for record year.

text.p: Chase Brass Industries Inc said Wednesday it is optimistic 1996 will be another record year, after citing strong third quarter and nine-month results that it attributed to increased brass rod shipments.
"Increased brass rod shipments were the primary force behind a 54 percent increase in gross profit in third quarter 1996 compared with the prior year," the company stated.

Earlier the company reported that third-quarter net income rose 47 percent to $5.0 million, or $0.50 per share. Nine- month net income rose 22 percent to $15.3 million, or $1.52 per share, compared with $12.6 million in 1995, the company said.
"We are optimistic that 1996 will be another record year for Chase," Chief Executive Martin Alonzo said.
